section_purpose: This abstract introduces the paper's core research question, which is investigating the limitations of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in certifying the unsatisfiability (UNSAT) of Boolean formulae, suggesting a potential failure in learning broader logical reasoning tasks.
key_points: Bridging GNNs and logical reasoning is feasible and valuable.
While GNN-based solvers have seen success for Boolean SAT, their performance on more complex predicate logic formulae is unclear.
The paper conjectures, with evidence, that generally-defined GNNs have limitations in certifying UNSAT for Boolean formulae.
This implies GNNs may fail at learning logical reasoning tasks that include proving UNSAT as a sub-problem, which is common in predicate logic.
